intro: Torilis heterotricha, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that appear in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Torilis heterotricha is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
